I recently visited Lake Seokchon at the Sakura Festival and it is definitely one of the best places to see the cherry blossoms. We loved taking pictures here and taking a walk along the lakeside path. We also saw big salmon swimming in the lake under the bridge. This afternoon was very interesting and I felt very peaceful, although there were a lot of people because of the festival. We were lucky to be here in the cherry blossom season. The sidewalk around the lake is full of blooming flowers. I also noticed an orchestra playing at the bends (I certainly don't feel they'll be there for long), but it adds a better atmosphere to the place.

The air is fresh and it is a good place to relax. In short, Shicun Lake Water Park is a worth visiting attraction.

Ishimura Lake was originally the main river of the Han River flowing through downtown Seoul. When the Han River was landfilled, some of the waterways were cut off and became lake water. Then it flourished and became Ishimura Lake Water Park. In spring, the cherry blossoms here are the most beautiful seasons of the year. Sakura trees are planted along the shore of the lake, and the pale red cherry blossoms are covered with flowers, and even the pale red reflections in the lake are beautiful.

The Seoul History Museum displays different old artifacts, and there are many models showing the life of the previous people, and a giant model shows the overhead view of modern Seoul.

Other than that, my overall experience here was good. We stumbled upon this museum by chance and were glad we found it! It is a delightful museum that shows Seoul residents pride in their city and history. On one of the floors, there is a huge city miniature layout. You can stand on it or you can stand next to it and see the layout of the city. You can choose the community and highlight the place, but unfortunately the feature is not available in English. I was impressed by the achievements of the people of Seoul in rebuilding the city after the war.

If you want to know more than 2,000 years of Korean history, it's good to come to the History Museum. The ticket is 700 won. It closes on Monday. Seoul Square was a classic venue for street cheerleading during the 2002 World Cup in Korea and Japan, and since May 2004, it has changed into a grass park and appeared in front of people. The grass park, which measures 12,540 square metres and is open oval, is connected by a sidewalk to the main entrance of the city hall and will be used as a space for citizens to rest, gather or hold cultural events. The planned reduction of the area of the driveway in front of the Guanghua Gate and around Chongli Gate, which were originally a major traffic road, will create a pedestrian-centered leisure and entertainment space for pedestrians. Visitors can roam freely in the bustling downtown area and experience the historical and cultural changes in downtown Seoul.

Seoul Plaza (Seoul Plaza) is located in Seoul Central District, which once became a classic venue for street cheerleading during the 2002 World Cup in Korea and Japan, and since May 2004, it has changed into a grass park and appeared in front of people. The grass park, which covers an area of 12540 square meters and is an open oval, is connected by the sidewalk and the main entrance of the city hall, and has become one of the most important venues for public rest, gathering or cultural events. Seoul Square is a new tourist attraction for Seoul citizens and foreign tourists who come to Seoul to experience Seoul's cultural diversity. It is open to tourists all year round. On one side is a ground fountain, and in the hot summer months, it is filled with laughter from children who come to play in the water. In winter, the square will become an ice rink, bringing people a different kind of fun. The ice rink is open from December to February, and visitors can enter the venue for only 1,000 won. Whether it is a lover in a hot relationship or a high school student who comes to play with classmates, you will have a good time here. In addition, lighting facilities are installed around the square to make the night square more dazzling.

Opposite Seoul Square is the "Dahan Gate", and we arrived just in time for the "Gatekeeper handover ceremony" at 11:00. The "Gatekeeper handover ceremony of the Royal Palace" is the guarding ceremony and handover ceremony of the gatekeepers who are responsible for opening and closing the gates, guards and patrols of the palace. It can be comparable to the guard change ceremony of the British royal family, and is an activity to reproduce the traditional palace culture of South Korea. After watching the handover ceremony, we went directly to the Guangzang market and solved lunch there. The Guangzang market is famous for RM and Jiang Hudong. Uncle Hu Dong still looks like he ate ten snacks in the market and made ten expressions. The market is the most lively place that reflects the local customs, and the food street that gathers various local snacks in South Korea is simply a paradise for foodies.
